page.title: 07CLUTTON PARISH CHURCH
page.content: Clutton Parish Church is named after St. Augustine of Hippo. He is best known because he wrote a book called 'The Confessions'. He was born in North Africa.The tower is the only remaining part of the medieval church, mentioned in the Domesday Book.It is 19.5 metres tall. In 1865. Rev. Johnstone the Rector, rebuilt the main part of the church. The famous actor, Henry Irving, has connections with Clutton. Members of his family the Brodribbs are buried in the churchyard.When it was Christian Aid week, all the children in the school went down to see a hut made of cardboard and tape in the churchyard. It was built to show us the kind of house that children in the {Third {World}countries often have to live in. We managed to squash 12 girls in it. We would not like to live in it.
